creator: nathaniel.ye@conagrafoods.com
text:
If I click the back button of my browser, or refresh the deploy URL, or through 
any other means, to reach a URL like this one: 
http://localhost:8080/manager/deploy?path=/foo, the existing web application 
named "foo" and its directory will be removed.

This message appears:
OK - Undeployed application at context path /foo
FAIL - Encountered exception java.util.zip.ZipException: The system cannot find 
the file specified

I have no idea why you're using this request (you should go through the HTML
manager from your browser; right now, it invokes the redeploy-from-previous-tag
feature with a null tag), but it's not a valid request. I suppose this could be
handled a bit better.
creator: remm@apache.org

text:
I think the chances of this one being fixed are slim, as the deployer and 
related code that affects this bug are being rewritten for Tomcat 5.1.
creator: yoavs@computer.org
yoavs@computer.org
text:
I've added JavaScript confirmation to the manager tasks like stop, start, 
deploy, undeploy, etc.  As for refreshing your own browser, be careful doing 
that when in an admin/manager web page ;)  I suppose we could code some sort of 
a form token into the page but that seems like overkill for a problem no one 
else has complained about.
